Blogs.title: The Antidote to Envy
Blogs.discription: I recently came across a passage from Krishamurti’s Think On These Things that gave me pause. I rarely highlight entire paragraphs when I read, but this one was so poignant that I had to elevate it from the page and into my memory.

Blogs.title: Ode to Spring
Blogs.discription: Let me dream of mandolins, buds of spring that paint the rusted winter’s cage, with gentle air poking through sculpted clouds, farewell to quilted charcoal sky

Blogs.title: Five Steps For How I Build Brands
Blogs.discription: I will say this until undertakers shovel gravel and dirt over my face — data is directional, but definitive. Data is your tour guide, your backstage pass, and the operator’s manual you instantly bin when you unpack IKEA furniture or complex appliances.

Blogs.title: The Curse of Perfect
Blogs.discription: My parents believed this so deeply that they left China with a one-way plane ticket and hundreds of dollars in folded bills, their mouths full of broken English.

Blogs.title: What’s Going On? The Silicon Valley Bank Collapse vs. the 2008 Financial Crisis
Blogs.discription: Silicon Valley Bank, the financial industry, and how we move forward — When you’re driving, you have a reasonable assumption that other drivers will follow the rules.

Blogs.title: Beginning Again At Fifty-Five
Blogs.discription: Trying to knock sense into the younger generation is not for the faint of heart — In one of my earlier pieces on writing, Singaporean author Alvin Ang asked me in the comment section

Blogs.title: AI and the American Smile
Blogs.discription: Imagine a time traveler journeyed to various times and places throughout human history and showed soldiers and warriors of the periods what a “selfie” is.

Blogs.title: The [Heart] of the Matter
Blogs.discription: 1976, New York designer Milton Glaser sat in the back seat of a taxi and arranged three capital letters and a stylized red heart into one of the most effective slogans in contemporary branding history.
